sources.title: Adam and Evalyn
sources.description: Title: Adam and Evalyn Summary: When a friend dies, a gambler adopts his daughter. Complications ensue. Directed by: Harold French Actors: Stewart Granger, Jean Simmons, Edwin Styles Production Company: Two Cities Films Release Date: 26 December 1949 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 Color: Black and White The father of a girl in an orphanage has been writing his daughter, who doesn't remember him, tales of his success in business. Actually, he is impersonating a friend, a handsome gambler. When the father dies, the gambler takes to girl from the orphanage and tells her the truth. But the girl is now a full-grown beauty and complications arise, including those provided by a black-sheep brother.

metadata.Plot: The father of a girl in an orphanage has been writing his daughter, who doesn't remember him, tales of his success in business. Actually, he is impersonating a friend, a handsome gambler. After the father dies, the gambler takes the girl from the orphanage and tells her the truth. But the girl is now a full-grown beauty and complications arise, including those provided by a black-sheep brother.
metadata.Writer: Noel Langley, Lesley Storm, Nicholas Phipps
metadata.Actors: Stewart Granger, Jean Simmons, Helen Cherry
